results.title: [Russell Boyd and Russell Crowe interviews for Master and Commander : The Movie Show]
results.brief_description: Margaret Pomeranz interviews cinematographer Russell Boyd and actor Russell Crowe about working on the film ‘Master and Commander: the far side of the world’, directed by fellow Australian Peter Weir. This collaboration illustrates the importance of maintaining a strong local film industry to both take Australian film-makers overseas and inspire future generations.

results.title: [Romper Stomper review : The Movie Show]
results.brief_description: Despite their shared passion for film, Margaret Pomeranz and David Stratton often disagreed wildly on the films they reviewed on their program, ‘The Movie Show’. A notable case in point is their review of Geoffrey Wright’s film, ‘Romper Stomper’, where they have two very different readings of the theme of racism in Australia.

results.title: [Peter Greenaway interview for Prospero's Books : The Movie Show]
results.brief_description: Margaret Pomeranz, co-host of ‘The Movie Show’, interviews film-maker Peter Greenaway about his film, ‘Prospero’s Books’. Greenaway discusses the origins of the project, working with acting legend Sir John Gielgud and some of the creative processes behind the film.

results.title: [Fred Schepisi interview for Roxanne : The Movie Show]
results.brief_description: In this interview filmed as part of SBS’s ‘The Movie Show’, Margaret Pomeranz interviews film director Fred Schepisi on the success of his film ‘Roxanne’. They discuss the collaborative process of filmmaking, selecting the right crew and working with comedian/actor Steve Martin.

results.title: [Dancer in the dark review : The Movie Show]
results.brief_description: This review by ‘The Movie Show’ hosts Margaret Pomeranz and David Stratton is one of the more fiery exchanges between the two reviewers. Lars von Trier’s “grim musical” ‘Dancer in the Dark’ is the film under the microscope, inspiring wildly different perspectives from Margaret and David.

results.title: [Nashville review : The Movie Show]
results.brief_description: In ‘The Movie Show’, Margaret Pomeranz and David Stratton look back on some of the classic films of the past. In this clip, the subject is Robert Altman’s ‘Nashville’ (1975), a breakthrough film for its episodic and improvisational elements.

results.title: Turmoil [game trailer]
results.brief_description:
This challenging platform game takes place in the year 3000, amid environmental chaos. Your task is to deliver the final piece of a time machine that will allow scientists to travel to the past to introduce sustainable thinking practices.

This trailer illustrates how the game is played.

results.title: [Celebrating the Site's Flora and Fauna]
results.brief_description: Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona is an environmental wonderland, containing rare flora and fauna. Much of the original landscape has remained untouched for over 100 years. This takes us back to a time when it was formally landscaped, and representative of the early Edwardian planting of the late 1880s. Please enjoy a serene journey through the reserve, celebrating this unique ecosystem.

results.title: [The Dead Table]
results.brief_description: There’s never been any explosions at the Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona, but accidents, well that’s another story. As a child, Alan Dyall’s father worked at the reserve in Melbourne’s west. One of his many jobs involved ‘laying out in the lighters’, a lighter being a boat that carried explosives from Williamstown to the steamship. If the steamship hadn’t yet arrived, it was his job to sleep on board until it did. This is a childhood of tales lovingly recalled and the amazing story of his father’s near fatal accident.
results.description: There’s never been any explosions at the Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona, but accidents, well that’s another story.
